name: Seated Dumbbell Side Lateral
how_to_perform:
# Seated Dumbbell Side Lateral Exercise 

## Instructions: 

1. Sit on a bench or chair with your feet flat on the floor in front of you, and hold one dumbbell in each hand.
2. Hold the dumbbells at shoulder height, with your palms facing towards your body.
3. Lift both dumbbells out to the sides until they are level with your shoulders, keeping your arms straight and your core engaged throughout the movement.
4. As you lift the dumbbells, focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together and contracting your lateral deltoids.
5. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions on both sides.
6. Repeat the process with the other arm, following the same motion.
7. Ensure you maintain proper form throughout the exercise, focusing on engaging your core muscles and keeping your movements controlled.
short_summary: The seated dumbbell side lateral is a shoulder-focused exercise that targets the lateral deltoids and involves lifting one or two dumbbells out to the sides while sitting.
